name: metrically
content:
metrically adverb
(MEASUREMENT)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that uses or relates to a system of measurement that uses metres, centimetres, litres, etc.: Timber has been measured metrically for years. A pound is a measure of weight equal to 16 ounces or, metrically, 453.6 grams. Related word
metric
More examplesFewer examplesThe remote control measures 8.4 inches or, for the metrically minded, 21.3 centimetres.Are foreign football pitches measured metrically?We soon got used to seeing distances beside the road marked metrically.

metrically adverb
(RHYTHM)
in a way that relates to the metre (= rhythm) of a piece of poetry or music : The song consists of several metrically identical verses. The poem is less odd metrically than it seems when read with modern speech patterns. Related word
metrical
More examplesFewer examplesMetrically, her verse was extremely conventional.To play this piece correctly you should play it metrically, with great care given to the length of each note.
